sociologistDataKey
Basic biological needs are met. Emotional and physical bonds between baby and parent.
Self control of behavior and body functions occurs. Behaviors that are socially acceptable are learned and they wish to abide by
Imagination starts to develop. Language improves. Has a self-image of ones self
Kids learn to complete tasks. Learn to share and play nicely.
Child develops self-identity. Time of rebellion and question.
Risktaking entering into a caring and loving state.
Adult needs to contribute back to his or her world
Able to look back on the past and feel a sens of accomplishment based on what they feel is important
Child spends time on sensation and movement. Learning requires motor response that is converted to pleasurable sensation. Object permanence at 10 months.
Children are not yet able to fully function in society. Vocabulary expands greatly. Reversibility not yet functioning. Unable to see from someone elses point of view.
Object permanence, conversation and reversibility are fully operational. World and its values are seen in black and white. Very hard to understand grey issues.
Has ability to think symbolicly. Truth, justice, personal rights and freedom. Altruistic. Not everyone gets to this stage.
Moral behavior is determined by parents. Cannot grasp right and wrong. They only understand punishments and rewards. Very self centered.

In the beginning children need the approval of others. Then children learn how to interact under certain social conditioning. Child now begins to judge why people do what they do. Many adults do not go beyond this stage.
Morality drives their action. Personal ethics drive one\'s actions. Concerned with the rights of others. Very few truly reach this stage.
